node.title: ‘Return of the Jedi’ and ‘The Fellowship of the Ring’ Join National Film Registry
node.alt: Carrie Fisher, center, Mark Hamill and Harrison Ford in “Return of the Jedi.”
node.description: Those movies, along with “Selena,” “Wall-E” and “A Nightmare on Elm Street” are among 25 selected by the Librarian of Congress.
node.content: ["It\u2019s not just Gollum who thinks a certain ring is precious.", "The first in Peter Jackson\u2019s epic trilogy of films based on J.R.R. Tolkien\u2019s novels, \u201cThe Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring\u201d (2001), is among the motion pictures that have been chosen for preservation this year on the Library of Congress\u2019s National Film Registry. Also being added are the final installment in another beloved trilogy, \u201cStar Wars: Episode VI \u2014 Return of the Jedi,\u201d and the disarmingly sweet Pixar comedy \u201cWall-E.\u201d", "On Tuesday, the library plans to make its annual announcement that 25 more films, dating from 1902 to 2008, will be honored for their historical and cultural significance and added to the registry, helping to preserve them for future generations.", "The selection of \u201cReturn of the Jedi\u201d (1983) is the culmination of a yearslong campaign by \u201cStar Wars\u201d fans to add the film to the registry. Hispanic lawmakers and experts earlier this year had also pushed for the inclusion of \u201cSelena,\u201d Gregory Nava\u2019s 1997 biopic of the Tejano singer Selena Quintanilla-P\u00e9rez that starred Jennifer Lopez in her first major film role. Supporters hoped that choosing it could serve as an example that would help open more doors for Latinos in movies and television.", "A group of notable films are also among the selections: \u201cSounder,\u201d Martin Ritt\u2019s 1972 drama about a family of Black sharecroppers in 1930s Louisiana that earned Cicely Tyson an Oscar nomination for best actress; \u201cA Nightmare on Elm Street,\u201d Wes Craven\u2019s 1984 horror classic that starred Robert Englund as Freddy Krueger; and \u201cWall-E,\u201d Andrew Stanton\u2019s 2008 Pixar sci-fi film about the last robot left on Earth, which won an Oscar for best animated feature.", "This year\u2019s class also includes a pair of cult favorites: \u201cWhat Ever Happened to Baby Jane?,\u201d Robert Aldrich\u2019s 1962 thriller about an aging child star (Bette Davis) left to care for her sister (Joan Crawford), and \u201cPink Flamingos,\u201d John Waters\u2019s 1972 underground comedy starring Divine.", "The library noted that the lineup includes a number of films by influential directors of color, among them \u201cThe Watermelon Woman\u201d (1996), the first feature by Cheryl Dunye, who also starred as a young Black lesbian struggling to make a documentary about a beautiful actress; \u201cCooley High\u201d (1975), Michael Schultz\u2019s comedy about Black high school seniors in 1960s Chicago; and \u201cChicana\u201d (1979), Sylvia Morales\u2019s 22-minute documentary tracing the history of Chicana and Mexican women.", "Three documentaries that address racially motivated violence against people of color have also been selected: \u201cThe Murder of Fred Hampton\u201d (1971), Howard Alk and Mike Gray\u2019s look at the leader of the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party (Hampton was also the subject of a studio drama this year, \u201cJudas and the Black Messiah\u201d); \u201cWho Killed Vincent Chin?\u201d (1987), Christine Choy and Renee Tajima-Pe\u00f1a\u2019s examination of the fatal beating of a young Chinese American engineer by two white men in Detroit; and \u201cRequiem-29\u201d (1970), David Garcia\u2019s chronicle of a brutal police attack on Chicano protesters in Los Angeles in 1970 that left the journalist Ruben Salazar dead.", "The lineup also honors several silent films that challenged stereotypes, including the oldest film in this year\u2019s class, \u201cRingling Brothers Parade Film\u201d (1902), a three-minute recording of a circus parade in Indianapolis that also shows a prosperous northern Black community. \u201cThe Flying Ace\u201d (1926) is an aviation romance with an all-Black cast, and \u201cHellbound Train\u201d (1930), made by the Black evangelical couple James and Eloyce Gist, was played in churches to scare sinners straight.", "The Library of Congress said in a statement that these additions bring the total number of titles on its registry to 825, chosen \u201cbecause of their cultural, historic or aesthetic importance to preserve the nation\u2019s film heritage.\u201d Movies must be at least 10 years old to be eligible, and are picked by Carla Hayden, the Librarian of Congress, after consulting with members of the National Film Preservation Board and other specialists. The library also allows the public to submit nominations at its website. More than 6,100 films were nominated this year, with the highest number of votes going to \u201cReturn of the Jedi.\u201d", "A television special, featuring several of these films and a conversation between Hayden and the film historian Jacqueline Stewart, will be shown Friday on TCM.", "Here is the complete list of the 25 movies chosen for the National Film Registry:", "1. \u201cRingling Brothers Parade Film\u201d (1902)", "2. \u201cJubilo\u201d (1919)", "3. \u201cThe Flying Ace\u201d (1926)", "4. \u201cHellbound Train\u201d (1930)", "5. \u201cFlowers and Trees\u201d (1932)", "6. \u201cStrangers on a Train\u201d (1951)", "7. \u201cWhat Ever Happened to Baby Jane?\u201d (1962)", "8. \u201cEvergreen\u201d (1965)", "9. \u201cRequiem-29\u201d (1970)", "10. \u201cThe Murder of Fred Hampton\u201d (1971)", "11. \u201cPink Flamingos\u201d (1972)", "12. \u201cSounder\u201d (1972)", "13. \u201cThe Long Goodbye\u201d (1973)", "14. \u201cCooley High\u201d (1975)", "15. \u201cRichard Pryor: Live in Concert\u201d (1979)", "16. \u201cChicana\u201d (1979)", "17. \u201cThe Wobblies\u201d (1979)", "18. \u201cStar Wars: Episode VI \u2014 Return of the Jedi\u201d (1983)", "19. \u201cA Nightmare on Elm Street\u201d (1984)", "20. \u201cStop Making Sense\u201d (1984)", "21. \u201cWho Killed Vincent Chin?\u201d (1987)", "22. \u201cThe Watermelon Woman\u201d (1996)", "23. \u201cSelena\u201d (1997)", "24. \u201cThe Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring\u201d (2001)", "25. \u201cWall-E\u201d (2008)"]
